description: The deal would combine the owners of the grocery store chains Food Lion, Stop & Shop and Giant to create a company worth almost $29 billion.
title: Ahold and Delhaize Group Enter Preliminary Talks on a Merger
title_page: Ahold and Delhaize Group Enter Preliminary Talks on a Merger - The New York Times
text:
LONDON — The Dutch supermarket operator Ahold and Delhaize Group of Belgium said on Tuesday that they had entered early-stage discussions about a potential merger.
The deal would combine Delhaize, the owner of the Food Lion grocery store chain, with Ahold, which owns the Stop & Shop and Giant chains in the United States, creating a company worth about 25.6 billion euros, or about $28.6 billion, based on market capitalization.
If completed, the merger would create a company with €54 billion in combined sales and more than 6,600 stores, with the United States accounting for about 60 percent of its revenue.
“These discussions may or may not result in a future transaction,” Ahold said in a news release on Tuesday.
